Articles.Content:
> 
> Thanks Rom. If someone with your plugin maintains names and co-ordinates and posts into this thread, can it be 'imported' quickly? Is it a file that sits in 'plugin data' folder in txt format?

You can add locations from within the game. You select these directly on the map. Or you can copy paste them into the text file which is located in PluginData/romfarer/kps.txt (it will be created when you first open up the system). It's described in detail in the the manual.

The system already comes with a few pre-made example locations you can delete and modify as you wish. For reference, this is what the kps.txt looks like:

    Mun#4.16064834714487#-55.6260228246487#Crater 1Mun#63.5456339296924#-32.3903335090882#Crater 2Mun#13.1034661976821#20.7120616562151#Crater 3Mun#-9.00872987151143#81.8389789338056#Crater 4Mun#-20.0523976065337#135.036532057894#Crater 5Mun#6.97189113955997#-150.202351223027#Crater 6Mun#-37.6715834126541#4.7115849947796#Romfarer landingMinmus#-23.7466988564638#-342.025066661392#Romfarer was hereKerbin#62.6437630408871#-117.351140052713#Romfarer BayKerbin#20.6616392056821#-146.333447448622#KSC 2CelestialBody#Latitude#Longitude#LocationName <-format

KSP has blocked XML reading/writing so i had to make my own format, that may change in the future, and if it does, this file will be converted automatically. The coordinates are represented in decimal cause that's what KSP use internally and it is also real easy to parse and write up correctly. Let me know if you need support for sexagesimal (hours, minutes, seconds).

In game this looks something like this:

> ![screenshot38qc.png](http://img69.imageshack.us/img69/892/screenshot38qc.png)

Okay, so if someone volunteers to maintain the kps.txt file then we can share it here and others can use this with their mod. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That way when you sail over booster bay it will be quite clear where it is. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Okay, so if someone volunteers to maintain the kps.txt file then we can share it here and others can use this with their mod. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That way when you sail over booster bay it will be quite clear where it is. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I think at the very minimum you have to install and try the plugin for yourself.

Some updated maps for you all. If you get bored and don't know where to fly next then check out some of these natural landmarks. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[Mun sites](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/80858415/munsites.jpg)

[Kerbin sites](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/80858415/Kerbinsites1.jpg)

[KSC magnified](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/80858415/Kerbinsites2.jpg)

Hello everyone! IÃ‚Â´ve recently discovered the forums and saw this post, and thought it was a great idea!

@togfox are those all the features named so far?

Also, IÃ‚Â´d like to name a feature aswell. Do forests count as features?

And it might be just me, but the link to the map KSC magnified appears to be broken.

Kerbin link fixed. Thanks. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Those are all the named sites so far. You can name forest I guess. Instructions on the first post.

Never mind that, IÃ‚Â´ll just name and island.

The name is Valer Island!

Here the pics:

> 
> ![screenshot30b.png](http://img809.imageshack.us/img809/5518/screenshot30b.png)
>

I noticed that the north pole hadn't been claimed yet on the map, so I'd like to name the the 500km area around it the "Alteran Circle" (Kerbal name for Arctic Circle).

Here are the pictures:

I broke most of the rocket when I landed, but I managed to roll my way to 90 Degrees (North Pole)

![screenshot1bw.png](http://img6.imageshack.us/img6/313/screenshot1bw.png)

Unfortunately, you can't actually get a "daylight" picture of either of the poles, so the sun is only above the horizon because of the camera angle.

![screenshot2hh.png](http://img341.imageshack.us/img341/1879/screenshot2hh.png)

And this is to show that it IS the north pole and not the south one.

![screenshot0cy.png](http://img269.imageshack.us/img269/3125/screenshot0cy.png)
Nice effort. Alteran Circle it is, until someone nominates another name or two, then we can go to a poll. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
i claim this island Called DeadlyIsland reason i crash landend on it on the way to the south pole and died
Hey deadly, do you think you can crash land on it again and get the lat/long and altitude for the records. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Greetings, Members of the KGSS!

I hereby apply for naming a kerbographic feature. The required data can be found below.

Name: Sidwell Island

Coordinates: 71Ã‚Â° 5' 42" S|60Ã‚Â° 18' 28" E

> ![screenshot23.png](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/33258343/screenshot23.png)

Thanks for reading and hopefully considering this name!

Live long and prosper!

Thx Brain. A little zoomed out next time would be great. That's a fantastic pixel you've got there but I've no idea where that is. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Consider your little island registered. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This one is another small crater, and it could likely be named without poll due to how small it is, but a poll should be necessary if anybody else suggests anything other names due to the contents of said crater. Unless they do, the crater is small enough to be named straight off. (It being important 'n' all...)
Thanks Vostok. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

There are several places on the forums where that's been called Silisko Crater. I like that name, since at the time Nova was a major part of the community (not a dev) and was the first to find the munolith there. I propose Silisko Crater as a second option for Kubrick Crater.

i propose that the monilith near ksp shall be called squad's birth for in old kerbal time they belived in a god called squad that looked like a monkey in the milltary

( i named it becuase it is obviously the squads logo on it)

> 
> There are several places on the forums where that's been called Silisko Crater. I like that name, since at the time Nova was a major part of the community (not a dev) and was the first to find the munolith there. I propose Silisko Crater as a second option for Kubrick Crater.

Interestingly enough, no one has proposed Silisko's Crater in this thread. Now that it has been nominated, we can go to a poll, though I suspect it's an easy bet how that will end. None-the-less, the community shall decide.

Deadly: Thanks for your post. I'm not sure if we should be naming Monoliths. A monolith is just a monolith. It can be the "Monolith near crag mountain" for example, but it is still just a monolith.

I claim this this island chain if that is to big i claim the main island with the really small island around it and i shall call it ice cream island for it export vinniali icecream froms the south pole and rocky road and mint from mun minnmus and exports it all over the world also can any one put a map of kerbin with the claimed islands and lands
We'll call the main island "ice cream island" till someone else nominates another name. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Nice, deadly! I'd previously given the northern island of that chain the name [South Island](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/10088-Invention-Kerbin-Geographic-And-Science-Society?p=177876&viewfull=1#post177876), good to see someone name the big island at last!

I think both will need to go to polls eventually, but it's a good start.

Thanks!

Plaatinum\_Spark

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-17T19:08:04Z" title="08/17/2012 07:08  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 17, 2012</time> by Vostok**
You may be right. We don't have screenshots or coords for silisko so we'll have to wait.

My mistake, if so. I thought I'd seen some people refer to the munolith being in Silisko Crater, but it must have been "near Silisko Crater" instead.

Instead, let me propose "Clarke Crater" - same origin, but a bit more back to the original, let us say!
